Sentencas: In the rigorous testing environment of fuel electrodes, surface-modified and element-doped Sr2Fe1.5Mo0.5O6-delta (SFMO6) experiences RP phase decomposition, thereby significantly improving performance - an aspect often underexplored and underutilized.
Titulo: Multiphase engineering regulation of double perovskite and RP structure heterojunction interfaces for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Therefore, the design of a multiphase structure with complementary advantages and the exploration of their interactions become crucial.
Titulo: Multiphase engineering regulation of double perovskite and RP structure heterojunction interfaces for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: In the present investigation, SFMO6, which has outstanding redox stability, high conductivity, and catalytic activity, was combined with Sr3Fe1.5Mo0.2O7-delta (SFNO7) in different proportions.
Titulo: Multiphase engineering regulation of double perovskite and RP structure heterojunction interfaces for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: SFNO7, characterized by thermodynamic stability, absence of phase transitions, and mixed electrical conductivity, serves as an anode material.
Titulo: Multiphase engineering regulation of double perovskite and RP structure heterojunction interfaces for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: XRD results reveal structural stability, with minimal exsolution in a hydrogen environment, and good chemical compatibility.
Titulo: Multiphase engineering regulation of double perovskite and RP structure heterojunction interfaces for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: TEM confirms the heterointerface, while ECR results show a complementary role of D-chem and K-ex values for the two structures.
Titulo: Multiphase engineering regulation of double perovskite and RP structure heterojunction interfaces for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: At 800 degrees C, a composition comprising 70% SFMO6 and 30% SFNO7 demonstrates a notably low polarization resistance (Rp) of 0.12 ohm cm(2).
Titulo: Multiphase engineering regulation of double perovskite and RP structure heterojunction interfaces for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The maximum power density (MPD) reaches 725.7 mW cm(-2) at 800 degrees C, a 20% improvement compared to single-phase single-cell counterparts (578.9 and 574.1 mWcm(-2)).
Titulo: Multiphase engineering regulation of double perovskite and RP structure heterojunction interfaces for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: This research provides a valuable strategy for the preparation of complementary hetero-interface materials for SOFC anodes and supports the improvement of performance by controlling the decomposition of SFMO6 into the RP phase in a reducing atmosphere.
Titulo: Multiphase engineering regulation of double perovskite and RP structure heterojunction interfaces for solid oxide fuel cells
